snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders said the agreement would lift the hourly pay in New York City to $15 by the end of 2018, with slower increases elsewhere.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and state legislative leaders announce budget deal that will raise minimum wage in New York City to $15 by end of 2018, but introduce slower increases in other areas of state; wage issue is final part of estimated $150 billion-plus budget, which mixes school aid and infrastructure spending with prominent policy measures.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and VIVIAN YEE

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders said the agreement would lift the hourly pay in New York City to $15 by the end of 2018, with slower increases elsewhere.

headline.main: New York Budget Deal With Higher Minimum Wage Is Reached
headline.print_headline: Deal on Budget  in Albany Raises  Minimum Wage
